item.title: All stop lines have either faded or have completely gone. Raise, 1st July
item.description:

item.title: Column 4L222, 1st July
item.description:
One of the light fittings on top of column 4L222 (at top of westbound entry slip road to A2) is smashed/broken.

item.title: Column K008 has no lamp on top, K007 not changed to LED, 1st July
item.description:
Column K008 has no lamp on top, K007 has a double flourescent lamp on top and has not been changed to LED. When previously reported the response was that K008 belongs to Kent County Council... it doesn't these are both National Highways owned assets.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Dartford Bypass, Bean, Dartford
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 40 to 50tonne waste dumped from building site ., 30th June
item.description:
This waste I believe has been dumped from the adjacent site 51 Charlton church lane , The main issue apart from the dumping of the waste is one of huge safety for the Tennants bordering this property boundary the brick retaining wall is in danger of collapsing into adjacent properties in Floyd road ., the wall has a lean on it of 15 to 20 % . Could you please advise what can be done . There is real danger of someone being seriously hurt and massive property damage . Total disregard for people. Safety buy whoever has dumped this waste here .

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Floyd Road, Charlton, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Trip hazard to members of public. Paving stone loose and wobbly with concrete post about to fall over at some point. I fell over and hurt myself.I was walking home past the concrete post and slab in the area and tripped and fell.There is no accommodation for excess for lack of maintenance and I will be taking legal action if this is not dealt with., 30th June
item.description:
Trip hazard to members of public there is a large number of elderly people live in this area get this fixed ASAP. Hackney Council leaving parts of the estate in disrepair not doing their duty.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Osborne Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
